Title: Ben-Hur Official Trailer #1 (2016) - Morgan Freeman, Jack Huston Movie HD
Comment:
Although I agree with the comments on Hollywood & it's lazy cash cowing of remakes & choosing " Ben Hur " to me was a bad idea as it has been made (including this one) 4 times now that it's been remade....

But 2 early B&W versions were not talkies & the movie industry was in it's infancy & believe it or not the movie industry in it's very early genises used B&W Boxing Fights to make its money atbthe start, as Boxing was & still is a huge draw for people, as the pugilistic arts still is apart from when UFC took off, the only thing closed to legal blood sport & what kept the Romans happy with Chariot Races & Gladiatorial Battles made great sense to those who knew how to make money & exploit those doing this within the movie industry, as who doesn't love a good sword & sandles movie...

This genre is not one that has been done to death like the western films but when they did do them they were usually huge movies with big stars & even bigger budgets & after the disastrous attempt at making " Cleopatra " with Richard Burton & Elizabeth Taylor the studios decided no more as that movie nearly shut bankrupt Hollywood ti the point of closing it down for good & this was because of the timeframe the movie took to finally finish & the many financial disasters that hit that movie while making it & even the affair that started during the making of this movie with Burton & Taylor wasn't enough to save this movie & this genre was dropped until it eventually found a new audience after a much needed rest from this type of extravagant film..

Yes there's been some movies made about this timeframe & genre but it took Ridley Scott's " Gladiator " to make Hollywood & Fans to fall in love with this genre again...

All I know is I've just watched this version & found it to be a very good & entertaining movie that also added more content within the movie as far as the story's narrative was concerned,  but wasn't a butt numbing 3 hours plus movie....

I enjoyed this movie & if you give it a chance you may find, like myself, that although it's another remake it actually adds more overall depth than the Old Charlton Heston movie that's put on Tv every Easter...

And that is my overall point here with regards to the many negative comments & that is
 " Have you even watched this version of Ben Hur! "

I have never had much love or pander to someone who chooses a career as a critic & have never listened to their opinions whether it was films/books/music et al & I made up my own mind as to whether I liked something not critics...

I myself had tired of the very idea of a 4th version of " Ben Hur " as I grew up seeing the old B&W versions & obviously the biggest one that was a box office hit with Charlton Heston &  believe when I say I've seen that movie to the point that I'd never watch it again, & this is coming from a huge movie fan & aficionado of these movie's & it took only recently for me to actually go out of my way to watch this movie..

As I always do with any movie I leave the hype or negativity at the door & this is the best & truest version of Lee Wallace's " Ben Hur - A Tale Of Christ "

Although the main actors are well known in the movie industry, they delibaretly for budget reasons I'm guessing, went with actors that wouldn't come with a huge price tag but would still deliver a great performance...

Now I'll admit there are no award winning performances here, but that doesn't mean they didn't do a great job & if you watch this version you'll see a more realistic & potent version of Ben Hur...

Yes there are some content related to the Charlton Heston version but alot of this movie is fresher & has a slightly different take on this epic that was a best selling book which went on to become a book that the studios couldn't wait to make movies about as it has everything within it for a great movie/allegiance/love & hate/betrayal/religion/redemption/forgiveness/revenge & many more & though this movie isn't as long as the Charlton Heston version it crams in more content at half the time of that version...

I have to admit I was completely taken aback at how much they re-envisioned this & how much I enjoyed it, but as always I leave it up to others to make up their mind & not be swayed one way or the other but go in under neutrality...

It's in your hands!... " To Be Or Not To Be "


.....

I don't see what the spectator could learn from this gathering - the audience is left confused and without empowerment. The story jumps without any sense of transition. There is a focus on portraying war in a certain way. I don't think The battles happen in the dark - the commanders are maniacs. I did like the special effects. However they were a little bit over the top. I don't know why modern movies would be dumped down - I mean people are becoming more intelligent throughout the decades. But this is just nothing compared to what is considered the best movie of all times.

Comment: In the beginning of the movie when they presented Judah and Messalah as brothers, I had a bad feeling.  Several times during the movie, as it took major departures from the original story, I really wanted to walk out of the theater.  But at the end of the movie, when Messalah did not die and him and Judah rode off together into the sunset, I realized that was over two hours of my life I really wish I could get back.   Telling what happens in this movie is not spoiling it.  It is already so bad, there is no possible way to "spoil" it or make it any worse.  If you absolutely must see it, wait for it to come out on Redbox.

Title: Ben-Hur Official Trailer #1 (2016) - Morgan Freeman, Jack Huston Movie HD
Comment: After watching this i was surprised to find out that the movie is actually pretty good. Don't get me wrong , this is not close to the 1959 version , but it is still a good time with pretty good acting especially by jack Huston who gives a magnificent performance. The action is great and the scenery is descent. Also , this movie has a great soundtrack. Nothing like the two trailers.The only problem is the story sometimes , the editing and the pacing. Also i did not like how mesala's character was written although Toby Kebbell gives a stellar performance as always. I would recommend this movie to people who have watched the original because it makes some honorable changes to the classic story in order to keep things fresh. This is Ben-hur for another generation , Not as good as the old one , but a really good movie by today standards.

Title: Ben-Hur Official Trailer #1 (2016) - Morgan Freeman, Jack Huston Movie HD
Comment:
I still cannot believe they did a remake of Ben Hur. The original won ELEVEN Oscars, including two acting oscars. Charlton Heston was perfect as the main character, Stephen Boyd made of Messala one of the greatest villans ever, Hugh Griffith won a well deserved oscar playing Sheik Ilderim, Jack Hawkins was great, on another important role in a classic movie, and the master Finlay Currie touched us all playing Balthazar, one of the three Magi.

Scenes like the Chariot race and the one where Jesus giving water to Ben-Hur were cinematic miracles. And of course, the soundtrack, composed by the myth, the legend, the genius MIKLOS ROZSA, is one of the most beautiful things i've ever heard.

Anyway, the remaking of this movie was a sin.

Comment: What an amazing and inspiring film! I was very impressed with it. I liked it a lot better than the original. It was saturated in emotion. The score was great, the enormity of the special effects were breathtaking, and acting was superb. I felt like I was on a ride that ripped me apart, tossed me around, and then finally brought me back to a satisfying and beautiful place. I thought it was one of the best high quality films I have seen. What a beautiful story of redemption and forgiveness. Mark and Roma have done it again!

Comment: I just know I'm going to hate this movie! This one is way to flashy. The old one was raw and rugged. The new ones casting is terrible. The old one had an amazing cast with unbelievable acting that still gives me chills after watching it a hundred times before. All the CGI in the world couldn't compete with the incredible scenes in the real Ben Hur. It makes me so mad, because I've loved Ben Hur ever since I was old enough to know what movies were! It was so pure and just real and moving. I've even thought about someone making a remake, but I always said it would have to be an amazing cast to even come close to the old one! I mean they should have at least had someone like Tom Hardy or Daniel Crag, a real mans man! This guy looks like a little teenager, despite all the baby powder they put in his hair. And now they've gone and made this and no ones gonna make another one for at least another century! Why!?!?!?!?

Taking place at the time of Jesus, the story follows Jewish prince Ben-Hur, who falls into slavery after his adopted brother, a Roman officer, accuses him of treason. When Ben-Hur later seeks revenge as a charioteer, he encounters redemption‚Äîand conversion to Christianity.

Title: Ben-Hur Official Trailer #1 (2016) - Morgan Freeman, Jack Huston Movie HD
Comment: This is the 5th screen version of Lew Wallace's 1880 novel "Ben Hur: A Tale of the Christ" The other were released in 1907, 1925, 1959 and 2003. The 1959 movie won ELEVEN Oscars, a record that stood for 38 years.  Heston and Boyd (Masala) did most of their own chariot driving!
http://www.history.com/this-day-in-history/ben-hur-wins-11-academy-awards :  Best Picture, Best Director, Best Actor, Best Supporting Actor (Hugh Griffith, playing an Arab sheik who befriends Ben-Hur), Best Color Cinematography, Best Color Art Direction/Set Direction, Best Sound, Best Score, Best Film Editing, Best Color Costume Design and Best Special Effects. It was also nominated in the Best Adapted Screenplay category. Title: Ben-Hur Official Trailer #1 (2016) - Morgan Freeman, Jack Huston Movie HD
Comment: There are movies that you just don't remake. It's sacrilege. At first I didn't understand why more people weren't more outraged, after all people practically took to the streets about the Ghostbusters remake. Then I remembered the world we live in. The original Ben Hur is my moms favorite movie and I have always enjoyed watching it with her. The actors, the sets, the corny special effects. It's all timeless. You can't remake an iconic movie with a bunch of CGI and 3D animation with actors that could potentially be about as talented as Hayden Christensen. Why Hollywood didn't shut this down like they did with Madonna wanting to remake Casablanca with herself in the lead is beyond me.

Title: Ben-Hur Official Trailer #1 (2016) - Morgan Freeman, Jack Huston Movie HD
Comment: There are films that are simply disliked.............and then there are films that are despised. I'm afraid this will fall into the latter. Not just because it's a remake.....of a film that won 11 Academy Awards. Not just because it will turn the graves of Charlton Heston and William Wyler. But because this film is about Christ. The 1959 version never displayed his face......and already in this trailer we get a glimpse of it. Christ's depiction in the 1959 film is one of the most incredible revelations of character I've ever seen in cinema -- both enchanting and mysterious at the same time. There's a certain mystique in not displaying his face, not to mention respect to the figure himself, and we can already see that this remake missed that chance. And this is coming from an agnostic by the way. So to anyone who finds themselves reading this, please watch the 1959 version. It's not the original, as two renditions came before it. But it's the best. The version that will live into eternity.

Comment: Why can't Hollywood try to make a decent, authentic epic? I heard of this remake and was excited but after seeing the trailer I'm already gone off it. What twit thought it would look good to Rastafarianize Morgan Freeman?? It's so out of place.1959 was the last time this movie was made and it was for its time, an astonishing effort and most important, believable and thrilling even today. But no, instead  more silly and inaccurate fight scenes, more over the top cgi, Why not go back to the old school days like Spartacus and Ben Hur or even Gladiator, At least try to honour those great films of the past who relied on great acting and great directing with limited technology and they still manage to stand tall. People deserve better than yet another limp remake.

Title: Ben-Hur Official Trailer #1 (2016) - Morgan Freeman, Jack Huston Movie HD
Comment: Oh dear. I'm in my very early 20's now, and my grandfather showed me the old version when I was about ten, and I loved it. It was well-made, and the tension between the brothers was real but also painful.  As I recall, the reason Ben-Hur was arrested in the old version was because a pane had fallen from the roof terrace very close to the general or something, and they thought he had attempted an assassination. Later on, his brother/friend visits the terrace and another pane falls, making him realize it was not malicious intent. But it was played out in a very restrained way. This is another full-blown hollywood gloss-over I will probably not see.

Comment:
Nothing is sacred these days. To me it is another way we are slowly erasing history.
Seriously what's the deal with Whoopi Freeman and the dreads? That ruined it for me straight away.
Hollywood is full of sh*t and has been for many years but more so now than ever,completely out of touch with reality and the real world.
This will bring out the "race baiters" but I will say it anyway- It seems they have to stick a token black actor in every movie and then we have Marvel with a black Nick Fury. Marvel comics have always been about having a back story on it's characters and a black Nick Fury is wrong. Now they are going to make a black 007 which is absurd.
Ian Fleming has written dozens of 007 books and James Bond has a very distinct back story and it had nothing to do with a black man.
Make a movie about a white George Washington Carver or Duke Ellington and watch the sun catch fire.

Title: Ben-Hur Official Trailer #1 (2016) - Morgan Freeman, Jack Huston Movie HD
Comment:
Firstly - Any movie no matter if it's a classic epic, modern oscar bait or some generic action/comedy schlock was made in order to make the studio more money. That is what they care about. 
Secondly - Trailers can be incredibly misleading in terms of a movies tone. Just look how different the two Suicide Squad trailers are for an example of that.
Thirdly - Remakes allow a story to be introduced to a new generation. Whether the film is good or not ultimately doesn't matter as it brings the  existence of previous versions (i.e. Ben Hur 1959) to the attention of younger viewers. 
Ultimately I'd rather see a remake of Ben Hur to see what modern cinema can do with it than have them remake something from the 90s that's totally unnecessary. 
Plus this remake will have absolutely no affect on the 1959 Epic apart from bring it's attention to a younger audience. If you don't like the idea of this remake don't watch it and instead rewatch the classic.
BUT DON'T COMPLAIN ABOUT/DISMISS IT WITHOUT GIVING IT A CHANCE, AFTER HAVING SEEN ONE TRAILER IN A TIME WHERE MOST TRAILERS ARE CRAP ANYWAY NO MATTER THE QUALITY OF THE MOVIE THEIR ADVERTISING!

Title: Ben-Hur Official Trailer #1 (2016) - Morgan Freeman, Jack Huston Movie HD
Comment: I'm losing all respect for Mr. Freeman. Besides, he can't hold a candle to the great Hugh Griffith, who won the Best Supporting Oscar, for his role as the Arab who befriends Judah when he learns that Judah has run in the great chariot race in Rome, Circus Maximus. He sees how his horses respond to Judah, & let's him train them, & run them against Messala in the greatest action sequence EVER FILMED, the chariot race. Heston learned how to do it, as did Stephen Boyd, & it makes that sequence even more exciting. Only in one quick scene, did Heston have a double : the 2nd unit Director's son. Even the '25 version's chariot race is thrilling to watch. No CGI. They really did it. ---------------------Wolfsky9

Title: Ben-Hur Official Trailer #1 (2016) - Morgan Freeman, Jack Huston Movie HD
Comment: With movies like The Ten Commandments, Lawrence of Arabia, the original Ben-Hur, and more recently Gladiator and Troy even, Kingdom of Heaven, I gotta say we should be able to expect a higher quality-looking Sword-and Sandals-style kind of epic these days. I hope this will be great, but I just dunno...rock music to this sort of Biblical-era movie's trailer seems in bad taste. Then again, Reign of Fire turned out pretty good- music in trailer was misleading, as nonesuch appeared in the actual film. At least this doesn't look as lame as Gods of Egypt or Exodus: Gods and Kings...but maybe closer to the latter than I'm comfortable with. It may have been an incredibly good turn of luck that Gal Gadot was unable to appear in this film due to scheduling conflicts. Fingers crossed...

Title: Ben-Hur Official Trailer #1 (2016) - Morgan Freeman, Jack Huston Movie HD
Comment:
This is Terrible!!!  I am a very progressive Christian that watches Ben Hur every year around Easter.  This movie on the Religious side from this trailer alone does not seem to be actually about the original story which is Ben Hur: A Tale of the Christ.  It was the sub-context of Ben Hur's version of Jesus that truly is powerful, you never see his face but see others change from encounters with him as well as a huge miracle in the end which they seem to be dismissing by killing off the mom and sister and making into a revenge story.

on the non-religious side of things they took an epic movie and dumbed it down into a 2ish hour movie that is all fast and furious, and lacking all substance.  A dumber version of Gladiator not to mention the terrible CGI!!!

I have never written a comment on youtube but I was just too pissed off not to.  You will not be seeing me at this movie.

Title: Ben-Hur Official Trailer #1 (2016) - Morgan Freeman, Jack Huston Movie HD
Comment:
Everyone's a critic. From what they show here, it looks pretty decent. Curious as to whether or not they keep the 3+ hour run-time of the 1959 film. 

Horses in the chariot racing seem to be real for the most part, even in spots where you'd expect digital animals they look really good. Sweat and muscle tone visible. Looks like they've gone for a lot of practical effects, which is nice. On-site location shooting, another plus (take note, Gods of Egypt). 

Film doesn't release until August so I'm excited to see what else they have to show us, but as of right now the film looks really good. 11 Academy Awards good? Probably not. The director gives me some pause though. His only two big budget direction (been a producer for several) projects are "Wanted" and "Abraham Lincoln: Vampire Hunter." Eh.....

Anyway, excited to see what is to come of this.

Title: Ben-Hur Official Trailer #1 (2016) - Morgan Freeman, Jack Huston Movie HD
Comment:
1st of the trailer - is that recycled music from Gods of Egypt and Transformers i hear? I can tell we're stepping right back into the shoes of a religious artistic masterpiece of cinema here.

2nd part - If it weren't for the title of the movie, id say this is one of those fake movies that comes before Tropic Thunder. And, like Tropic Thunder, i do believe there will be a great deal of comedy that comes after. Freeman's predator disguise is even better than Tom Cruise's fat man disguise.

3rd part - Remember in the original Ben-Hur, when that stuntman died during the filming of the race? That movie was so artistic, that the real life event of his death was the foreshadowing of this movie.

If you took the amount of oscars the original won and took off 12 of them, this movie should have what was left.

Title: Ben-Hur Official Trailer #1 (2016) - Morgan Freeman, Jack Huston Movie HD
Comment:
CGI is supposed to be used when you are unable to bring your vision to the screen with practical effects. At the very least the chariot scene needs to be practical, because if a 1957 movie looks better than your 2016 version then you did something wrong.

This isn't going to hold up, which brings up the question why not just re-release the 1957 version, in 3D I don't care, that would allow young people to see it, the right way, as well as bring in the ticket sales you so desperately seem to need. Seeing an epic like Ben-Hur on the big screen is a bloody privilege. 

Why? The big question for this movies existence. If you are remaking a movie that is perfect or near-so, then you either need to do something completely different, a new interpretation if you will, like Magnificent Seven, or as previously mentioned re-release the original. But to have the nerve to do whatever hell this interpretation of Ben-Hur is, would be  on the same level as straight up remaking 12 Angry Men, The Good, The Bad and the Ugly or Lawrence of Arabia. 

Why are they making this - greed.

Title: Ben-Hur Official Trailer #1 (2016) - Morgan Freeman, Jack Huston Movie HD
Comment: Not bad not bad, not all too concerned that its a remake, the original did come out in 59 so its not like this is cashing in on its success, the poeple who saw that movie don't go to movies anymore so it really is for an audience who have for the most part never seen the movie.This could be the story for this generation, and I don't mind that. I mean, the John Carpenter "Thing" was a remake, Dracula has been done a handleful of times and Gatsby....what...3? 4 times? All of those for the most part have been fairly well received. The trend seems to be the sooner it is remade after the one before, the more criticism it receives. Nah, this is alright, I'd like to see what they do to the story for a modern audience. Besides, Toby Kebbell deserves a second chance for F4, he's an awesome actor. Don't believe me? Watch RocknRolla...and than everything else by Guy Ritchie now that I think about it. You could skip Sherlock Holmes but even those movies are alright.

Title: Ben-Hur Official Trailer #1 (2016) - Morgan Freeman, Jack Huston Movie HD
Comment:
To everyone upset about this movie being made...

Have you actually seen the original? While it is a classic film, it was made in 1959. So unless you are over the age of 57. you weren't even born when this film was made. Film buffs have probably all seen the movie given it being a classic film and really a great example of film-making overall. 

Hollywood is more than allowed to make another movie about a novel from the late 1800's that hasn't been touched for over 50 years. 

We get seemingly a half-dozen films a year based on some Young Adult Fiction series and they are all almost carbon-copies of each other from a story perspective. Adjust the setting and some minor tweaks here and there and you've got yourself a new series.

We've had countless movies about bible stories, including movies solely about Jesus. Dozens of films about famous Greek/Roman tragedies. Multiple versions of Shakespeare's works. They are all stories that are retold because of how well known they are and that they can still relate to us even today.

Not saying that this film will be great or anywhere near the original, but saying it should never have been made is silly.

Title: Ben-Hur Official Trailer #1 (2016) - Morgan Freeman, Jack Huston Movie HD
Comment: This looks epic! For all you Nay-Sayers why do you want to rob me of seeing portions of my favorite novel on the Big Screen that where not included in the 1959 version (Which was also a remake of the 1925 version which was considered a classics.) Why do you want to rob me of sharing this story with my wife who would love the story but wont take the time to read the novel and doesn't like old movies? Why do you want to rob me of the opportunity to pass down this story to my son who is more likely to enjoy a movie from his time lift time and not his grandfathers lifetime? You still have your Carlton Heston film... but that is not how I was introduced to the story and that is not the origin of the story! With how great the Ben-Hur (1959) was, it still paled in comparison to the book and completely butchered the end! Stop being so negative! This world is negative enough, a movie about compassion and mercy shouldn't be the subject of so much anger!
